features.name: Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Bug-Type Pokémon, Novice Command or Survival OR Elemental Connection (Bug), 1 Bug-Type Pokémon, Novice Command or Survival
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Bug) or Type Strategist (Bug). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Bug)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Bug-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Bug-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Bug) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Bug-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Bug)
features.Effect:
Your Pokémon with the following Capabilities have the upgrades below applied to them.
» Threaded: Your Pokémon may use its Threaded attack to perform the Trip, Grapple, Push and Disarm Combat Maneuvers and ignores Weight and Size restrictions when doing so.
» Wallclimber: Immunity to Push and Trip effects.
» Naturewalk: Immunity to Slowed or Stuck in its appropriate Terrains.
» Sky: Your Pokémon has a +1 bonus to its Speed Evasion.
features.name: Insectoid Utility

features.Prerequisites: Insectoid Utility, Adept Command or Survival
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is bound, if your Pokémon's Bug-Type attack would deal Super-Effective Damage, it gains a +2 Bonus to Accuracy Check. If it would deal Neutral Damage, it gains a Bonus to its Damage Roll equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank. If it would be resisted, it is resisted one step less. This is calculated after applying any other effects that would modify effectiveness before the Accuracy Roll is made, such as the Tinted Lens Ability.
features.name: Iterative Evolution

features.Prerequisites: Insectoid Utility, Expert Command or Survival
features.Trigger: Your Bug-Type Pokémon is hit by a Status-Class Move
features.Effect: The effect misses, and your Pokémon becomes immune to that Move for the rest of the Scene. Chitin Shield may be triggered once per Scene per Pokémon.
features.name: Chitin Shield

features.Prerequisites: Insectoid Utility, Master Command or Survival
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a Bug-Type Move
features.Effect: Until the end of user's next turn, all targets hit by the Move are Slowed, suffer a -X to Accuracy Rolls, and are Flinched by Damaging Attacks on 16+.
features.name: Disruption Order
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Dark-Type Pokémon, Novice Guile or Stealth OR Elemental Connection (Dark), 1 Dark-Type Pokémon, Novice Guile or Stealth
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Dark) or Type Strategist (Dark). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Dark)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Dark-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Dark-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Dark) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Dark-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Dark)
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon misses all targets with a Dark-Type attack on their turn
features.Effect:
Your Pokémon may apply two of the effects below after the triggering attack is resolved. Your Pokémon may also take a Standard Action to trigger this Feature. This Feature may be triggered only once per round.
» They gain +4 Evasion for one full round.
» Their attacks ignore Evasion from Stats until the end of their next turn.
» They may immediately Disengage as a Free Action.
features.name: Clever Ruse

features.Prerequisites: Clever Ruse, Adept Guile or Stealth
features.Target: Your Dark-Type Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is bound, when attacking foes that are Fainted, Flanked, Flinched, Sleeping, Stuck, Tripped, unaware of your Pokémon's presence, or otherwise do not expect an attack, the target gains a +2 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and a bonus to Damage Rolls equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.
features.name: Sneak Attack

features.Prerequisites: Clever Ruse, Expert Guile or Stealth
features.Trigger: Your Dark-Type Pokémon uses a Move with the Social keyword.
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may immediately use a naturally Dark-Typed Status-Class Move or a Move with the Social keyword as a Free Action. This must be a different Move than the triggering Move, and must follow all Frequency limitations. Devious may be used only once per Scene per Pokémon.
features.name: Devious

features.Prerequisites: Clever Ruse, Master Guile or Stealth
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Dark-Type Move
features.Effect: After the triggering attack is resolved, the target of the attack gains an Injury and falls asleep. If this attack would put them at 3 or more injuries or at or under 25% of their maximum Hit Points, the target instead becomes Fainted. Black-Out Strike may be used only once per Scene.
features.name: Black-Out Strike
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Dragon-Type Pokémon, Novice Command or Intimidate OR Elemental Connection (Dragon), 1 Dragon-Type Pokémon, Novice Command or Intimidate
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Dragon) or Type Strategist (Dragon). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Dragon)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Dragon-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Dragon-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Dragon) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Dragon-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Dragon)
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a Dragon-Type Move
features.Effect: Your Pokémon creates a Burst 2, Slowing all Foes in the area and causing those foes to lose 1 Combat Stage in any Stat in which they have positive Combat Stages
features.name: Tyrant's Roar

features.Prerequisites: Tyrant's Roar, Adept Command or Intimidate
features.Target: Your Dragon-Type Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target gains X Damage Reduction against Dragon-Type attacks, and gain a +X Bonus to Damage Rolls with Dragon-Typed attacks against other Dragon-Typed targets. X is equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.
features.name: Highlander

features.Prerequisites: Tyrant's Roar, Expert Command or Intimidate
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Dragon-Type Move while they have 3 or more Status Afflictions
features.Effect: Your Pokémon is cured of up to three Status Afflictions.
features.name: Unconquerable

features.Prerequisites: Tyrant's Roar, Master Command or Intimidate
features.Trigger: Your Dragon-Type Pokémon takes a Critical Hit or Massive Damage
features.Effect: Your Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage in each of Attack, Special Attack, and Speed. This Will Not Stand may trigger only once per Scene per Pokémon.
features.name: This Will Not Stand
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Fighting-Type Pokémon, Novice Command or Intimidate OR Elemental Connection (Fighting), 1 Fighting-Type Pokémon, Novice Command or Intimidate
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Fighting) or Type Strategist (Fighting). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Electric)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of an Electric-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Electric-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Electric) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Electric-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Electric)
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon's Damaging Electric Attack would inflict Paralysis on an already Paralyzed foe
features.Effect: For 1 full round, that foe is instead Stuck and may only use At-Will Frequency Moves.
features.name: Lockdown

features.Prerequisites: Lockdown, Adept Focus or Technology Education
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, whenever the target hits a foe with an Electric Attack, they may choose to have the foe lose Hit Points equal to the target's Tick value plus your Type-Linked Skill Rank. If they do, the target loses a Tick of Hit Points after the attack is resolved.
features.name: Overload

features.Prerequisites: Lockdown, Expert Focus or Technology Education
features.Effect: You may activate this Feature to have your Electric-Type Pokémon use an Electric-Type Move with a Frequency of At-Will as if it had Priority (Advanced).
features.name: Shocking Speed

features.Prerequisites: Lockdown, Master Focus or Technology Education
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging 1-target Electric Attack
features.Effect: Pick another Pokémon or Trainer within 3 meters of the target of the attack. You may repeat the triggering attack against the target, with a -5 Damage penalty. If you hit, you may repeat the attack a third time against a foe within 3 meters of the second target, this time with a -10 Damage penalty. The third target cannot be the same as the original target.
features.name: Chain Lightning
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Fighting-Type Pokémon, Novice Focus or Combat OR Elemental Connection (Fighting), 1 Fighting-Type Pokémon, Novice Focus or Combat
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Fighting) or Type Strategist (Fighting). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Fairy)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Fairy-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Fairy-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Fairy) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Fairy-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Fairy)
features.Effect:
Your Fairy-Type Pokemon may activate Fairy Lights as a Standard Action to create 3 Fairy Lights that hover around themselves. Whenever the target is attacked by a foe within 6 meters, they may expend a Fairy Light to either immediately gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points, or to use the Move Fairy Wind as a Free Action.
Special: Fairy Lights also provide mild lighting, comparable to a candle. As an extended action your Pokemon can control the lights individually, but they must stay within 6 meters of the Pokemon that created them.
features.name: Fairy Lights

features.Prerequisites: Fairy Lights, Adept Charm or Guile
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Fairy-Type Move
features.Effect: Your Pokémon and all allies on the Field gain a +1 Bonus to all rolls for one full round.
features.name: Arcane Favor

features.Prerequisites: Fairy Lights, Expert Charm or Guile
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is bound, whenever the target uses a 1-Target Move with the Social Keyword or a Fairy-Type Status Move, the foe hit by the triggering Move becomes Infatuated with your Pokemon, and immediately Shifts towards your Pokemon, forfeiting their next Shift Action. This may affect a specific foe only once per Scene.
features.name: Fey Trance

features.Prerequisites: Fairy Lights, Master Charm or Guile
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon creates Fairy Lights as a Standard Action
features.Effect: Your Fairy-Type Pokémon may activate Fairy Rite as a Standard Action to lose any number of Hit Points, up to a maximum equal to your Pokémon's Level, and heal an adjacent Ally by that many Hit Points. Then, if your Fairy-Type Pokémon has any Fairy Lights, they may immediately expend any Fairy Lights to gain a Tick of Hit Points, or cause an ally within 6 meters to gain a Tick of Hit Points.
features.name: Fairy Rite
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Fighting-Type Pokémon, Novice Combat or Intuition OR Elemental Connection (Fighting), 1 Fighting-Type Pokémon, Novice Combat or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Fighting) or Type Strategist (Fighting). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Fighting)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Fighting-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Fighting-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Fighting) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Fighting-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Fighting)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target's Fighting-Type Moves cause foes to become Marked by the target for 1 full round. If the target is a Fighting-Type Pokémon, they may also Mark the Foe for one full round when hitting with a Grapple, Trip, or Push Maneuver. Marked Foes provoke an attack of Opportunity from the Pokémon that marked them if they Shift out of an adjacent square into a square that is not adjacent, even if they use a Disengage Maneuver. Targets cannot be Marked by more than one Pokémon at a time.
features.name: Close Quarters Mastery

features.Prerequisites: Close Quarters Mastery, Adept Combat or Intuition
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon makes a Struggle Attack
features.Effect: This Struggle Attack has a range of Burst 1, Friendly instead of the usual range, and deals Fighting-Type Damage.
features.name: Brawler

features.Prerequisites: Close Quarters Mastery, Expert Combat or Intuition
features.Effect: While your Pokémon is adjacent to a foe they Marked, that foe gains a -X penalty to Accuracy Rolls and a -10 penalty to Damage Rolls on attacks that do not target the Pokémon that Marked them. X is equal to half your Type-Linked Skill Rank.
features.name: Face Me, Whelp

features.Prerequisites: Close Quarters Mastery, Master Combat or Intuition
features.Trigger: A Marked Foe provokes an Attack of Opportunity from your Fighting-Type Pokémon
features.Effect: The Attack of Opportunity automatically hits, deals Fighting-Type Damage, and is a Critical Hit.
features.name: Smashing Punishment
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Flying-Type Pokémon, Novice Combat or Intuition OR Elemental Connection (Flying), 1 Flying-Type Pokémon, Novice Combat or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Flying) or Type Strategist (Flying). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Fire)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Fire-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Fire-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Fire) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Fire-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Fire)
features.Effect: Your Pokémon's damaging Fire-Type Moves Burn their target on a roll of 18+. If a Move already has a chance to Burn a target, this Effect Range is instead increased by +3. Additionally, your Pokémon's damaging Fire-Type Moves deal additional damage equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank against Burned targets.
features.name: Brightest Flame

features.Prerequisites: Brightest Flame, Adept Focus or Intimidate
features.Trigger: Your Fire-Type Pokémon Shifts
features.Effect: Your Pokémon sets the ground aflame and leaves a Fire Hazard in each square it shifts through this round, up to a maximum of 8 squares. Anyone who begins or ends their turn on a Fire Hazard are Burned. Anyone that passes through a Fire Hazard loses a Tick of Hit Points. If a Ground, Rock, or Water-Type Move targets a square (or a target in a square) with Fire Hazard in them, the Fire Hazards are destroyed. All effects that destroy Hazards extinguish Fire Hazards. Trail Blazer may only be used once per Scene.
features.name: Trail Blazer

features.Prerequisites: Brightest Flame, Expert Focus or Intimidate
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target adds both their Attack and Special Attack Stat to all damaging Fire-Type Attacks, instead of one or the other. This does not stack with Twisted Power.
features.name: Incandescence

features.Prerequisites: Brightest Flame, Master Focus or Intimidate
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a 1-Target Fire-Type Move
features.Effect: Instead of its usual range, the attack may be performed as if it had a range of Burst 1 if melee, or Cone 2 if ranged.
features.name: Fan The Flames
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Flying-Type Pokémon, Novice Acrobatics or Perception OR Elemental Connection (Flying), 1 Flying-Type Pokémon, Novice Acrobatics or Perception
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Flying) or Type Strategist (Flying). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Flying)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Flying-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Flying-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Flying) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Flying-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Flying)
features.Target: A Flying-Type Pokémon, or a Pokémon with a Sky or Levitate Speed
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, add your Type-Linked Skill to the target's Initiative. Additionally, if the Target uses a Disengage Maneuver, they may Shift as if Slowed instead of shifting only 1 Meter.
features.name: Celerity

features.Prerequisites: Celerity, Adept Acrobatics or Perception
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Flying-Type Move with an Accuracy Check
features.Effect: You may roll the Accuracy Check twice, and resolve using either result. If both results would hit and you resolve the attack using the lower result, Gale Strike's Frequency is not expended.
features.name: Gale Strike

features.Prerequisites: Celerity, Expert Acrobatics or Perception
features.Effect: Your Flying-Type Pokémon may activate Zephyr Shield as a Standard Action Interrupt, or as a Shift Action during their turn. If they do, until the end of the user's next turn, all ranged attacks targeting them take a -1 penalty to Accuracy and -10 penalty to damage, they become immune to the effects of Moves with the Powder keyword, and they do not lose Hit Points from Weather effects. Additionally, if Zephyr Shield is used as a Standard Action, that Pokémon may use the Resolution Effect of a Flying-Type Move with the Set-Up keyword on their next turn, skipping the Set-Up phase.
features.name: Zephyr Shield

features.Prerequisites: Celerity, Master Acrobatics or Perception
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon gains Initiative
features.Effect: Your Pokémon gains 2 additional Standard Actions this turn. Your Pokémon may also Shift between taking each action, so long as their total Movement does not exceed their Movement Capabilities. All three of your Pokémon's Standard Actions this turn must be used to perform Zephyr Shield, or Flying-Type Moves with a Frequency of At-Will or EOT. Tornado Charge may be used only once per day per Pokémon.
features.name: Tornado Charge
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Ghost-Type Pokémon, Novice Intimidate or Occult Education OR Elemental Connection (Ghost), 1 Ghost-Type Pokémon, Novice Intimidate or Occult Education
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Ghost) or Type Strategist (Ghost). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Ghost)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Ghost-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Ghost-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Ghost) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Ghost-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Ghost)
features.Effect: Your Ghost-Type Pokémon may activate this Feature by spending a Shift Action to remove themselves from the field. They may not be targeted in any way during this time. At the beginning of their next turn, they reappear in any square of their choice that they could have Shifted to from their previous location. Each Pokémon may activate Ghost Step only once per Scene.
features.name: Ghost Step

features.Prerequisites: Ghost Step, Adept Intimidate or Occult Education
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect:
While this Feature is bound, the target gains a Curse Token each time they use a Ghost-Type Move or Ghost Step. Ghost-Type Moves with a Set-Up and Resolution Phase give a Curse Token for each Phase. As a Standard Action during their turn, or as Free Action upon Fainting, the target may spend their Curse Tokens to apply conditions to a foe within 6 meters.
» 1 Curse Token: The target loses a Combat Stage of your choice.
» 2 Curse Tokens: The target becomes Cursed.
» 3 Curse Tokens: The target becomes Suppressed.
» 4 Curse Tokens: The target falls Asleep and gains Bad Sleep.
features.name: Haunting Curse

features.Prerequisites: Ghost Step, Expert Intimidate or Occult Education
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits an adjacent foe with a Ghost-Type Move
features.Effect: Choose a Stat. The triggering foe loses a Tick of Hit Points and a Combat Stage in that Stat. Your Pokémon gains 1 Combat Stage in the chosen Stat, and a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.
features.name: Vampirism

features.Prerequisites: Ghost Step, Master Intimidate or Occult Education
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon reappears after using Ghost Step, or the set-up phase of Phantom Force or Shadow Force
features.Effect: The next Ghost-Type attack the target makes that turn gains the Smite keyword and can't be Intercepted or avoided in any way (Dodge, Parry, Shield Moves, etc).
features.name: Boo!
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Grass-Type Pokémon, Novice Survival or General Education OR Elemental Connection (Grass), 1 Grass-Type Pokémon, Novice Survival or General Education
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Grass) or Type Strategist (Grass). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Grass)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Grass-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Grass-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Grass) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Grass-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Grass)
features.Target: Your Pokémon with a Grass-Type Status Move
features.Effect: Pick a Grass-Type Status-Class Move known by the target. The chosen Move no longer takes up a Move Slot. A Pokémon may have only one Move bypass the Move Limit at a time; if a new Move is chosen for a Pokémon, the previous Move loses this effect.
features.name: Foiling Foliage

features.Prerequisites: Foiling Foliage, Adept Survival or General Education
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Sunny Weather.
features.name: Sunlight Within

features.Prerequisites: Foiling Foliage, Expert Survival or General Education
features.Trigger: Your Grass-Type Pokémon is hit by a damaging Bug, Fire, Flying, Ice, or Poison attack that deals Super-Effective Damage
features.Effect: Your Pokémon gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Type-Linked Skill Rank, and gains +1 Combat Stage in the Stat of your choice. If it is Sunny, they may gain +1 Combat Stage in a second, different Stat. You may activate Enduring Bloom only once per Scene per Pokémon.
features.name: Enduring Bloom

features.Prerequisites: Foiling Foliage, Master Survival or General Education
features.Trigger: Your Grass-Type Pokémon uses a damaging Grass-Type Move
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may immediately use a Grass-Type Status-Class move as a Free Action.
features.name: Cross-Pollinate
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Ground-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Survival OR Elemental Connection (Ground), 1 Ground-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Survival
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Ground) or Type Strategist (Ground). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Ground)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Ground-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Ground-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Ground) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Ground-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Ground)
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon with the Groundshaper Capability uses a Ground-Type Move
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may use the Groundshaper Capability as a Free Action. When used this way, Groundshaper creates Spike Hazards in each square turned into Rough or Slow Terrain. If you wish, instead of Groundshaper's normal range, you may choose to affect the square targeted by the attack and all cardinally adjacent squares. If the triggering Move is a Burst, Blast, Line, or Cone, you may choose to affect all squares in the targeted area instead.
features.name: Mold the Earth

features.Prerequisites: Mold the Earth, Adept Perception or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in a Sandstorm.
features.name: Desert Heart

features.Prerequisites: Mold the Earth, Expert Perception or Intuition
features.Effect: Your Ground-Type Pokémon may activate Earthroil as a Shift Action to use a damaging Ground-Type Move as it had a range of Line 4 or Burst 1 instead of its usual range, and as if it had the Groundsource keyword. 1-Target Moves performed this way take a -5 penalty to their Damage Rolls.
features.name: Earthroil

features.Prerequisites: Mold the Earth, Master Perception or Intuition
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses the Groundshaper Capability, or a Move with the Groundsource keyword
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may make a Trip Attempt as a Free Action against any Pokémon targeted by the Move, or standing on a square changed by the Groundshaper capability. Your Pokémon gains a bonus to their Combat Roll equal to half of your Type-Linked Skill Rank.
features.name: Upheaval
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Ice-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Survival OR Elemental Connection (Ice), 1 Ice-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Survival
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Ice) or Type Strategist (Ice). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Ice)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of an Ice-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Ice-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Ice) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Ice-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Ice)
features.Effect: Your Ice-Type Pokémon gain Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank against Fighting, Fire, Rock, and Steel-Typed Attacks from which they would take Super-Effective Damage.
features.name: Glacial Ice

features.Prerequisites: Glacial Ice, Adept Athletics or Survival
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Hail.
features.name: Polar Vortex

features.Prerequisites: Glacial Ice, Expert Athletics or Survival
features.Trigger: Your Ice-Type Pokémon uses an Ice-Type Move
features.Effect:
Your Pokémon uses the Move Mist as if it were on their Move List. When used this way, in addition to its normal effects, your Ice-Type Pokémon may expend uses of the Mist Blessing to do the following:
» As a Swift Action on their turn to cause a foe within 5 meters to take a -5 penalty to Damage Rolls and become Slowed for one full round.
» As a Free Action when being hit by a Fighting, Fire, Rock, or Steel-Typed attack dealing Super-Effective Damage to add their Tick Value to their Damage Reduction gained from Glacial Ice.
» As a Swift Action on their turn to increase their Defense or Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage.
features.name: Arctic Zeal

features.Prerequisites: Glacial Ice, Master Athletics or Survival
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Ice-Type Move
features.Effect: The target is Frozen, and has their Attack, Special Attack, and Speed Combat Stages lowered by 1 each. The target is automatically cured of the Frozen Condition after 1 full round. A foe may be affected by Deep Cold only once per Scene.
features.name: Deep Cold
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Normal-Type Pokémon, Novice Charm or Intuition OR Elemental Connection (Normal), 1 Normal-Type Pokémon, Novice Charm or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Normal) or Type Strategist (Normal). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Normal)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Normal-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Normal-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Normal) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Normal-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Normal)
features.Target: Your Normal-Type Pokémon with Last Chance or Normal Strategist.
features.Effect: Your Pokémon gains the Last Chance or Normal Strategist Ability, whichever one they do not already have. Extra Ordinary can target a Pokémon only once.
features.name: Extra Ordinary

features.Prerequisites: Extra Ordinary, Adept Charm or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is bound, instead of rolling for damage with Normal-Type Moves, your Pokémon acts as if they rolled the maximum value on their Damage Dice Roll. Plainly Perfect only works for the first instance of the Damage Dice Roll on Critical Hits.
features.name: Plainly Perfect

features.Prerequisites: Extra Ordinary, Expert Charm or Intuition
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a Normal-Type Move with conditional modifiers which increase or decrease its damage
features.Effect: You use the highest damage value for the triggering Move. (Examples: Return is DB 9, Wring Out never has its damage decreased due to the target's Hit Points, Retaliate is DB 14) New Normal may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon. New Normal may not raise a Move's Damage Base above 14; if a Move would have its Damage Base raised above that value, it is instead raised to 14.
features.name: New Normal

features.Prerequisites: Extra Ordinary, Master Charm or Intuition
features.Trigger: Your Normal-Type Pokémon gains Initiative
features.Effect: Add your Type-Linked Skill Rank to all of your Pokémon's rolls this turn. Your Pokémon gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Simple Improvements may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.
features.name: Simple Improvements
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Poison-Type Pokémon, Novice Charm or Intuition OR Elemental Connection (Poison), 1 Poison-Type Pokémon, Novice Charm or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Poison) or Type Strategist (Poison). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Poison)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Poison-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Poison-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Poison) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Poison-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Poison)
features.Trigger: Your Poison-Type Pokémon inflicts Poison on a foe
features.Effect: The foe does not necessarily lose Special Defense Combat Stages from Poison; instead, they lose Combat Stages in the Combat Stat of your choice. Whenever the target loses Hit Points from Poison, they lose additional Hit Points equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.
features.name: Potent Venom

features.Prerequisites: Potent Venom, Adept Intimidate or Stealth
features.Target: Your Poison-Type Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, when the target successfully hits a Poisoned or Blighted foe with a Poison-Type Move, the foe gains a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls and Evasion for one full round.
features.name: Debilitate

features.Prerequisites: Potent Venom, Expert Intimidate or Stealth
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon misses with a Poison-Type Move
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may use either Smokescreen or Poison Gas as if they were on their Move List. When used this way, these Moves ignore Frequency Limitations, and are used as a Ranged Blast 3, with the blast centered on the square targeted by the triggering attack. Poison-Type Pokémon are not negatively affected by Smoke Screens created this way. Your Pokémon may also trigger Miasma deliberately as a Standard Action.
features.name: Miasma

features.Prerequisites: Potent Venom, Master Intimidate or Stealth
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Poison-Type Attack
features.Effect: The target gains the Blight Condition for one full round. Blighted targets lose a Tick of Hit Points upon being hit by any attack. If the attack is Poison-Typed, the Blight effect's duration is refreshed.
features.name: Corrosive Blight
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Psychic-Type Pokémon, Novice Focus or Occult Education OR Elemental Connection (Psychic), 1 Psychic-Type Pokémon, Novice Focus or Occult Education
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Psychic) or Type Strategist (Psychic). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Psychic)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Psychic-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Psychic-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Psychic) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Psychic-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Psychic)
features.Effect: Your Psychic-Type Pokémon may activate Psychic Sponge as a Shift Action to add a Psychic Type Move known by an ally within X meters to their Move List until the end of their turn. This does not allow them to have duplicate Moves in their Move List. This Feature may only be used once per Pokémon per Scene, and X is equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.
features.name: Psionic Sponge

features.Prerequisites: Psionic Sponge, Adept Focus or Occult Education
features.Target: Your Psychic-Type Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target's damaging Psychic-Type Moves gain a +1 Bonus to Effect Range and a +3 Bonus to Damage Rolls for each of the following conditions that the target is suffering: Bad Sleep, Confusion, Curse, Disabled, Flinch, Infatuation, Rage, or Suppression.
features.name: Mindbreak

features.Prerequisites: Psionic Sponge, Expert Focus or Occult Education
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Psychic-Type Status Move
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may use the Move Encore against the triggering foe, as if it was on their Move List.
features.name: Psychic Resonance

features.Prerequisites: Psionic Sponge, Master Focus or Occult Education
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Psychic-Type Status Move with a range of Blessing, Field, Hazard, or Self.
features.Effect: Your Pokémon may immediately use another Psychic-Type Status Move from its Move List with a range of Blessing, Field, Hazard, or Self.
features.name: Force of Will
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Rock-Type Pokémon, Novice Combat or Survival OR Elemental Connection (Rock), 1 Rock-Type Pokémon, Novice Combat or Survival
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Rock) or Type Strategist (Rock). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Rock)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Rock-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Rock-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Rock) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Rock-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Rock)
features.Trigger: Your Rock-Type Pokémon misses all targets with a Rock-Type attack, receives an Injury, suffers a Critical Hit, or Faints.
features.Effect: Create a Stealth Rock Hazard adjacent to your Pokémon.
features.name: Gravel Before Me

features.Prerequisites: Gravel Before Me, Adept Combat or Survival
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Rock-Type Move
features.Effect: All targets hit by the triggering Move are pushed a number of meters equal to half your Type-Linked Skill Rank or less, and they become Vulnerable for one full round. Create a Stealth Rock Hazard adjacent to each foe hit this way.
features.name: Bigger and Boulder

features.Prerequisites: Gravel Before Me, Expert Combat or Survival
features.Target: Your Rock-Type Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, allied Stealth Rock Hazards within 4 meters of your Pokémon are not used when a foe triggers them unless you want them to be. Whenever the target takes Super-Effective Damage from a Water, Grass, Ground, Fighting, or Steel Type Attack, they may consume an allied Stealth Rock Hazard within 4 meters to create temporary armor that grants them Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank for one full round.
features.name: Tough as Schist

features.Prerequisites: Gravel Before Me, Master Combat or Survival
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon misses with a Damaging Rock-Type Move
features.Effect: The Move gains the Smite keyword for that use.
features.name: Gneiss Aim
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Steel-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Intimidate OR Elemental Connection (Steel), 1 Steel-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Intimidate
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Steel) or Type Strategist (Steel). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Steel)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Steel-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Steel-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Steel) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Steel-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Steel)
features.Effect: The Effect Range of your Pokémon's Steel-Type Moves is increased by +2.
features.name: Polished Shine

features.Prerequisites: Polished Shine, Adept Athletics or Intimidate
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: When this Feature becomes Bound, the target gains +1 Defense Combat Stage. While the Feature remains bound, the target's Defense Stat cannot be lowered, and its Defense Combat Stages cannot be lowered.
features.name: Iron Grit

features.Prerequisites: Polished Shine, Master Athletics or Intimidate
features.Trigger: Your Steel-Type Pokémon is hit by a damaging attack
features.Effect: Your Pokémon gains Damage Reduction against the attack equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Additionally, calculate Type Effectiveness with this attack as if your Pokémon has no Typings besides Steel.
features.name: Assault Armor
Type Ace
features.Prerequisites: 2 Different Water-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Intuition OR Elemental Connection (Water), 1 Water-Type Pokémon, Novice Athletics or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
features.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Water) or Type Strategist (Water). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Water)
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: The target regains one use of a Water-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Water-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.
features.name: Type Refresh

features.Prerequisites: 3 Type Ace (Water) Features
features.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
features.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Water-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.
features.name: Move Sync

features.Prerequisites: Type Ace (Water)
features.Effect: Your Water-Type Pokemon may activate Flood! as a Shift Action to use a damaging Water-Type Move as if had a range of Line 4 or Close Blast 2 instead of its usual range.
features.name: Flood!

features.Prerequisites: Flood!, Adept Athletics or Intuition
features.Target: Your Pokémon
features.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Rainy Weather.
features.name: Fishbowl Technique

features.Prerequisites: Flood!, Expert Athletics or Intuition
features.Trigger: Your Water-Type Pokémon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack
features.Effect: You may choose to take a penalty to the Damage Roll for the attack up to triple your Type-Linked Skill Rank or up to half the rolled damage for the triggering attack, whichever is lower. Your Pokémon gains twice that value in Temporary Hit Points and may cure themselves of one Status Affliction. Fountain of Life may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.
features.name: Fountain of Life

features.Prerequisites: Flood!, Master Athletics or Intuition
features.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack
features.Effect: All targets of the attack are put in a Vortex, and take a penalty to all Damage Rolls equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank while in the Vortex.
features.name: Aqua Vortex
